conbody.p: A checkbox is a square box, usually with a label next to it, that represents an option. Using the mouse, you can select the option (a checkmark is displayed in the box) or remove the option (no checkmark is displayed). Unlike radio buttons, checkboxes are used for options that are not mutually exclusive. This means that you can make multiple selections (more than one) from the list of options.
